entry.title: Tender Moments
entry.summary:
Author: BerriUsagi

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,516Chapters: 2/3Kudos: 37

Summary: "I missed our date," Bruce said, as Clark set him on the foot of his bed and gently brushed his hair back from his face."You did," Clark nodded, sitting beside him, "We can plan another."Bruce groaned, hunching over, bracing his elbows on his knees, and rubbing his hands over his face. Tonight was meant to be a night for him to relax, to get to enjoy some time with Clark and not be The Bat for a night.

entry.title: Every Inch of You
entry.summary:
Author: acatcam

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 34,612Chapters: 24/?Kudos: 324

Summary: "This is a love story." | "This is a detective story" When Clark Kent follows a story into Gotham, he doesn’t expect to find himself face-to-face with the city’s true guardian: a bat with fangs, claws, and a half-feral silhouette in the shadows. Suspicious, circling him like prey, Batman tests every ounce of Clark’s resolve—only for Clark’s clumsy optimism to slip through anyway (“What the hay, are those fangs?”). Between the silk shawls and champagne smiles of Bruce Wayne, Gotham’s Pretty Boy Playboy, and the smudged-eyeliner hunger of the Bat with Fangs, Clark finds himself drawn to both—the golden boy in the sun and the monster in the dark. He doesn’t break Bruce’s walls with force, but with patience, reverence, and devotion. The monster who refuses to hurt the one he loves, and the hero who would even offer his own blood to keep him alive.

entry.title: Kryptonite and Coffee
entry.summary:
Author: brmqtr

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,911Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 21

Summary: A story of one grumpy detective, one overdramatic alien, and far too much caffeine. When a mission at LexLabs goes sideways, Superman is hit with experimental Kryptonite radiation that sends his powers into chaos. Sometimes he can fly; sometimes he can’t even lift a coffee pot. Batman insists on “monitoring” him — which, according to Clark, means hovering, glaring, and pretending it isn’t love. Between sneezes strong enough to break lab equipment and late nights under observation, Clark finds that being vulnerable around Bruce isn’t so bad. Bruce, of course, disagrees — right up until the moment he doesn’t. Because for every sarcastic remark and clinical scan, there’s the quiet truth neither of them can quite deny: when the powers fade, the heartbeat stays. A romantic comedy about Kryptonite exposure, domestic chaos, and the world’s most stubborn love story.

  • No Archive Warnings Apply

entry.title: Bruce Goes Batty
entry.summary:
Author: AtlasDaMoth

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,797Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 735

Summary: In Bruce Wayne's opinion, as The Batman and Gotham's Billionaire, magic was both incredibly illogical, and quite stupid. Guns, swords, secret plots and evil schemes, he could deal with it all. Except for magic. Spells, curses, it was all unknown to him, and he hated it.He formed that idea on the subject at least a good three years ago. And now, as he stares at himself in the mirror, shaking hands gripping the long bat ears that had sprouted upon his head, he finds himself proven right yet again.Magic. Stupid, stupid magic.

entry.title: Two Heroes and a Baby
entry.summary:
Author: xxEmilee_Lunaxx

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 49,292Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 288

Summary: In this AU, 19-year-old Bruce Wayne adopts 4-year-old Dick Grayson after he is orphaned by a tragic event at Haly's Circus. Bruce is in over his head trying to juggle establishing himself as a responsible and valuable asset to Wayne Enterprises, beginning his vigilante work in Gotham as The Batman, and parenting a young child despite not knowing where to start. After struggling to get good press and constantly being seen as an irresponsible nepo baby, he sets up an interview at The Daily Planet. That's where he meets 19-year-old intern Clark Kent, who is eager to write a good story to begin his career as a journalist. After Clark agrees to keep an eye on Dick during his interview, Bruce realizes he has a knack for watching children, especially young Dick Grayson. Bruce asks Clark to come live with him at Wayne Manor on a 6 month assignment as Dick's nanny, and in return, will let Clark write the story of a lifetime--an expose on his life that no other reporter has even come close to. Clark reluctantly agrees, but is hiding a secret from Bruce--his life as the superhero, Superman! As the two begin their friendship and double lives as heroes, they learn valuable lessons in friendship, love, and parenting.

entry.title: i like men called ‘daddy’
entry.summary:
Author: blue_moon_blooming

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,516Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 82

Summary: Batman tends to get in his head when it’s quiet for too long. There’s never a moment when he isn’t thinking. Calculating, worrying, assessing. And it’s not to say that Superman doesn’t admire that! He’s seen Batman close cases that went cold decades ago, seen him come up with strategies and schemes that “foolproof” doesn’t even begin to describe. It’s just…he’d like to give the man a break, once in a while. Let him have a chance to turn his brain off.

entry.title: Holy Ghost, Batman

Author: Amorloran

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 161,449Chapters: 36/?Kudos: 492

Summary: In a post-Glitch in Time AU, 17-year-old Danny Fenton finds out he was adopted. His biological parents? Tim Drake and Stephanie Brown! Now he has to learn to accept how this changes things. And then Dani is back on top of it all? Great! Mature slice-of-life and shenanigans.
